newsitem.title: UK: Worldwide Advertising & Media Digest - May 19.
newsitem.headline: Worldwide Advertising & Media Digest - May 19.

text.p: ....REUTERS WORLDWIDE ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST.....
Reuters news from around the world on Advertising, Marketing, Media, the Internet, Brand-name Products and Consumer Trends ***********************************************
ADVERTISING & MARKETING:

LONDON - Peter Wilson, chairman and chief executive of Gallaher, Britain's largest cigarette maker and owners of the Benson and Hedges and Silk Cut brands, attacks plans by the newly elected Labour Party to ban cigarette advertising.

MIAMI- Burger King says it will begin selling dinosaur-decorated wristwatches as a promotional tie-in to "The Lost World: Jurassic Park", the sequel to Steven Spielberg's "Jurassic Park" movie due this summer.

WINSTON-SALEM, North Carolina - R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co says it will launch a new, nationwide marketing campaign for its Winston cigarette brand. The campaign, called the "No Bull" campaign, seeks to position Winston as an "authentic, straight-up kind of brand," says Edmund Leary, vice president of marketing for Winston.

CHICAGO - UAL Corp, parent of United Airlines, says it will unveil a new advertising campaign in New York this week which will reflect its new customer satisfaction philosophy. "We believe our new service philosophy will set United apart from its competitors, motivate our employees to new heights of service, and drive above-industry growth and revenues," Chairman Gerald Greenwald says.

COLOMBO - Sri Lanka will launch a global public relations campaign next month to attract investors and tourists by playing down a 13-year-old war with separatist Tamil rebels, Tourist Board officials say.

LONDON - British marketing services company Lopex Plc confirms it received a tentative approach that "may or may not lead to an offer being made" from another UK communications and marketing group Incepta Group.
MEDIA & THE INTERNET:

LONDON - British satellite television operator BSkyB and Cable and Wireless Communications are in talks over co-operation on pay-per-view television, due to be launched next year, according to the Sunday Telegraph newspaper.
ZURICH - Advertising pages in Swiss newspapers rose 3.3 percent in April compared with a year earlier, according to figures compiled by the WEMF media tracking agency.

ENGLEWOOD, Colorado - DMX Inc and TCI Satellite Entertainment Inc say they have entered into an agreement to jointly offer Primestar's television programming and DMX music services to commercial customers.

CAMPBELL, California - Semiconductor maker Zilog Inc. and privately-held consumer Internet software developer PlanetWeb say they have developed an integrated design for building television set-top boxes for Internet access that can retail for less than $200.

PALO ALTO, California - NetChannel Inc will become the latest in a series of companies with broad consumer electronics backing to dive into the market for providing Internet access over the television. It is announcing a deal with Thomson Consumer Electronics to provide an internet delivery service for $19.95 a month.
BRAND-NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS:
NEW YORK - McDonald's Corp plans to revamp the top management structure of its U.S. business in an attempt to improve profits and build its market share, the New York Times says.
LONDON - British drinks group Guinness Plc says it has no plans to streamline brands as a result of its proposed merger with Grand Metropolitian Plc.
SINGAPORE - Cigarette company Rothmans Industries Ltd says it continues to view the future for its brands in Singapore with optimism.

NEW YORK - A week after Mazda Motor Corp announced it would cut its North American staff by 25 percent in a restructuring, the automaker is now looking to trim its U.S. dealership network, the Wall Street Journal says.
TOKYO - Japanese telecoms giant NTT is expected to ring up higher annual profits on the back of a boom in cellular phones and Japan's growing obsession with the Internet analysts say.
CONSUMER TRENDS:

MANAMA, Bahrain - Tourists from neighbouring Gulf Arab states are flocking to Bahrain for a break. The archipelago, the Gulf's main financial and banking hub, has become a regional tourism centre and hotels are mushrooming to accommodate increasing numbers of visitors.

PHAN RANG, Vietnam - The Allied Domecq Ninh Thuan Co Ltd winery, the first joint venture winery in Vietnam is battling against the odds -- and an adjacent minefield -- to produce wine for the Vietnamese market
